id:
SpaceX is having another successful launch
NextBigFuture.com
paragraph:
SpaceX has launched the Es’hail-2 satellite on Thursday, November 15 from Launch Complex 39A (LC-39A) at NASA’s Kennedy Space Center in Florida. The satellite will be deployed to a geostationary transfer orbit (GTO) approximately 32 minutes after liftoff. The first stage has successfully landed. 
										Read next:
										SpaceX gets approval for 7,500 more satellites »
